info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 05 at 4:27PM CDT until May 05 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL BROWN COUNTY... At 425 PM CDT, a cluster of severe thunderstorms continue to strengthen across southern Brown County near Camp Bowie, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Zephyr around 440 PM CDT. Blanket around 500 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Indian Creek and Owens. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
